alert.note: Alert for Gloucester; Lancaster; Mathews; Middlesex (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 26 at 3:59PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Gloucester, southeastern Middlesex, Mathews and southeastern Lancaster Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 358 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Hartfield, or near Deltaville, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Mathews, Urbanna, Deltaville, White Stone, Gwynn, Hartfield, Blakes, Moon, Harmony Village, Grafton, Harcum, Cash, Amburg, Greys Point, Fort Nonsense, North, Soles, Dutton, Diggs and Weems. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects.
